column3:
<UIForeground>F201FC</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FD</UIGlow> Quest Sync<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
Grawley needs estimates and he needs them now.
Request supply estimates from the villagers.
Listen, friend, I'm run off my feet here. I need someone to take stock of our remaining food stores, and you just volunteered.

Nigh everything this village needs to survive is hauled up from the lowlands, and if matters don't settle down soon... Well, I won't be surprised when Wright and Stilltide begin hoarding goods instead of selling 'em. Not unless it's for an outrageous price.
Anyway, that's enough speculation. I need estimates─accurate estimates, mind you─from them what's in charge of our edibles. Grains, grog, and meats. Off you hop.
Grains, grog, and meats. Speak to the villagers and find out what we've got left...
Grawley wants an estimate? Well you can tell him, “Not bloody much.” We'll need to think of something 'cause we're runnin' low on both grain <Emphasis>and</Emphasis> beans...
Grawley wants an estimate? Well you can tell him, “Not bloody much.” We'll need to think of something 'cause we're runnin' low on both grain <Emphasis>and</Emphasis> beans...
<sigh> We've put a good dent in the liquor we got from the dwarves, so we might have to make do with water at some point. At least we've a fresh source with the river nearby.
<sigh> We've put a good dent in the liquor we got from the dwarves, so we might have to make do with water at some point. At least we've a fresh source with the river nearby.
Hmmm. I'd say we have more than enough dried meat to go around. There was peril in the hunt, but the haul was plentiful.
Hmmm. I'd say we have more than enough dried meat to go around. There was peril in the hunt, but the haul was plentiful.
...Grain is a problem, then. I'll see if we can't trade our surplus meat in Wright for a few sacks of barley and the like.
That will get us through for the moment, but we'll need to come up with a long-term plan...
...Well, I'll think of something. Thanks for doing the legwork, friend! Say, have you ever considered taking up work as a quartermaster...?
